intro: Werauhia hylaeana, commonly known as the silver-tipped werauhia, is a species of flowering plant native to the humid forests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its striking, silver-green foliage with a waxy texture. The plant produces showy inflorescences that range in color from yellow to orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. It typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in the canopy layer of tropical rainforests. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
